brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is determine safety and efficiency of mechanical ventilation in
      children with two different types of single use laryngeal masks (Ambu AuraOnce vs. LMA
      Supreme). The main interest is leakage pressure of oropharynx and stomach. The null
      hypothesis is that leakage pressures of Ambu AuraOnce and LMA Supreme  are equivalent. The
      alternative hypothesis is that there is a difference in leakage pressure.

clinical_study.brief_title: Laryngeal Mask Ambu Aura Once vs. Supreme in Children

detailed_description.textblock:
Before starting surgery patients will be anesthetised and airway managed either with LMA
      Ambu AuraOnce or Supreme. Ventilation parameters, stomach inflation, and hemodynamic
      parameters will be measured.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Children aged 1-10 years

          -  ASA I - III

          -  Elective procedure in general anaesthesia

          -  Parental informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Non fasting patient

          -  Body mass index > 35 kg/m2

          -  Cervical spine pathologies or peripheral neurologic deficiences

          -  Malformations of upper airway or head

          -  Anamnestic hiatus hernia or esophageal reflux

          -  Status post operation of stomach or esophagus

          -  Recurrent respiratory infection or obstructive airway disease

          -  Non elective procedure

intervention.description: airway management and mechanical ventilation with laryngeal mask
airway management and mechanical ventilation with laryngeal mask

clinical_study.official_title: Ventilation With Laryngeal Mask Ambu Aura Once vs. Supreme in Children

overall_official.affiliation: University Hospital Innsbruck, Department of Anaesthesia + Intensive Care

oversight_info.authority: Austria: Austrian Medicines and Medical Devices Agency

primary_outcome.description: After ventilation has been established the leakage pressure will be measured, ie 1min after establishing ventilation

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: After ventilation has been established the efficient ventilation, tidal volume and stomach inflation will be measured, ie 3min after establishing ventilation

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment
clinical_study.why_stopped: Other studies with the same protocol have already published.
